meanings.definition: Capable of being evaluated or assessed.
meanings.sent1: The teacher provided an evaluable rubric for the students to follow.
meanings.sent2: The evaluable data helped the researchers draw meaningful conclusions.
meanings.sent3: It's like having a map that shows you where to go - very evaluable!
meanings.sent4: Her skills were evaluable gems in the company's talent pool.
meanings.sent5: The evaluable feedback from customers guided the company's product development.

meanings.definition: Able to be judged or measured.
meanings.sent1: The quality of the fabric was evaluable by its softness and durability.
meanings.sent2: His performance was evaluable based on the results of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The cat's evaluable hunting skills made it the star of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an evaluable treasure in a world full of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The evaluable impact of the new policy was evident in the increased productivity.
